comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: George L. Crosman was President of the Portland (Maine) Chamber of Commerce, see article „Peary Urges an Air Patrol for Our Coast“ by Rear Admiral Robert E. Peary in The New York Times, November 14, 1915, last column, which mentions Ingraham as mayor of Portland as well. William M. Ingraham (Dem) 1915 (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_mayors_of_Portland,_Maine) see also The New York Times, December 8, 1914 In 1916, Ingraham was assistant secretary of war, see Bisbee daily review., May 20, 1916, Page 5, Col. 2, with photo.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Peary of course is Robert Edwin Peary, Sr. (May 6, 1856 – February 20, 1920), "an American explorer who claimed to have led the first expedition, on April 6, 1909, to reach the geographic North Pole." (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Peary)
